availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Haines Lytle (Cincinnati, Ohio, lawyer, Brigadier General (U.S.A.))

body.p: Cincinnati, Ohio, lawyer and soldier. Ohio native. Son of Robert T. Lytle and Elizabeth H. Lytle. Lawyer in Cincinnati, Ohio in 1860. Served as Colonel of the 10th Ohio Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) on May 3, 1861. Served as Brigadier General U. S. Volunteers (U.S. A.) in November 29, 1862. Died on September 20, 1863 from wounds at Chickamauga, Georgia.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States_ (1860), Population Schedules, Ohio, Cincinnati, Ward 1, p. 52.

Heitman's Register and Dictionary of the U.S. Army Vol.1, Part II. p.631.
